newsitem.title: USA: MTS Systems FY96 revenues increase.
newsitem.headline: MTS Systems FY96 revenues increase.

text.p: MTS Systems Corp said on Monday that revenues for fiscal 1996, ended September 30, rose 11 percent to $260 million.
New orders for the fiscal year totaled $283 million, up 16 percent from a year ago.
MTS, which makes computer-based testing and simulation systems, said it will report final, audited results for the fourth quarter and fiscal 1996 in late November.

"Both new orders and revenue exceeded our plan for the year primarily due to a resurgence of our mechanical testing and simulation business in Europe and Asia-Pacific," Donald Sullivan, chairman, said in a statement. "We entered our fiscal 1997 with a $122 million backlog of profitable business; that's up over 20 percent from last year."
